alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Cleburne (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 1:58PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cleburne and southeastern Cherokee Counties through 230 PM CDT... At 158 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mars Hills, or 11 miles east of Piedmont, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pleasant Gap, Mars Hills, Oak Level, Borden Springs, Liberty Hill and Spring Garden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northeastern and east central Alabama.
